project-basis: I used Amazon Web Services, including Lamda, S3, Cloudwatch, and the Alexa Skills Kit.
project-challenges: Figuring out how to debug with the Alexa Skills Kit.
project-future-plans: Next steps are to create a more adaptive game with different levels that challenge users with harder questions as the game continues. Then, create a multi-player, turn-based game where users can compete against each other. Finally, develop user accounts to store previous game results and help players and parents identify which type of math problems the player can improve upon.
project-purpose: The app creates an endless number of addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division problems to practice using the Amazon Echo. It's a great alternative to math flash cards.
project-inspiration: My kids kept asking me to quiz them with math questions.
project-lessons-learned: Developed and published my first custom skill on Amazon Alexa in less than 48 hours.
project-accomplishments: My kids can have fun learning math on a screen-less device.
project-subtitle: A fun, simple math game for kids and adults alike... without a screen!
